page.title: 05DUNSBURY FARM
page.content: { DUNSBURY FARM}is situated south of {BROOK DOWN.}It covers 1200 acres,and produces mainly arable crops: barley,wheat,potatoes and cauliflowers.Around 12000{SHEEP}are kept on the surrounding hills. The farmer employs 7 farmhands, including a shepherd who lives on-site in one of the farm cottages.The manager is absentee,living in Bembridge. The day begins at 7.30a.m, comparatively late because there are no cows to milk. The main problem for the farmer is {SALT}from the English Channel.The salt is blown onto the farm,where its destructive properties turn plant leaves black and shrivelled.Very little can be done about this problem, yet it still worries the already over-worked farmer.
